lg.l: Nightly the sun retires to rest,
In crimson, gold and grey,
With sadness are our hearts oppressed,
God send the rain to-day.

The drought fiend Drought fiend. The Federation Drought, which commenced in 1895 and peaked in 1901-2, affected most of eastern Australia and is regarded as one of the continent’s worst droughts. stalks upon the land,
Holds desolation’s sway,
The showers we have are only sand,
God send the rain to-day.

The waters dried, Waters dried. The Lachlan River, which flows near the town of Condobolin, is part of the Murray-Darling basin that was severely affected by the Federation Drought. the earth is bare,
There’s nothing can repay;
The stock are dying Stock … dying. Australia’s sheep and cattle numbers were reduced by 40-50% by the end of the Federation Drought. everywhere,
God send the rain to-day.
All nature languishes in pain,
Without one cheering ray,
Oh! When will verdure come again?
God send the rain to-day.
All our hopes are fixed on Thee;
Oh hear us while we pray,
Before thee now on bended knee
God send the rain to-day.
